hero.heading: Welcome to CAPDIMW.org
hero.text: Creating a free socially excluded living environment to advance sustainable citizen rights.

gridSections.title: Organizational Goals
gridSections.vision: To create a free socially excluded living environment to advance sustainable citizen rights.
gridSections.mission: To systematically promote inclusiveness among socially excluded groups to enhance full involvement at all levels of decision-making process.

gridSections.title: Geographical Location
gridSections.text: The organization has secretariat in Bangwe Township-Blantyre district, along Mvula road in old Samaritan Trust campus. Its branch is located at Bangula in Nsanje district.

gridSections.title: Economic Empowerment Programmes
items: HIV and AIDS and disability management

posts.title: Description of economic empowerment programme
posts.text: The primary idea is to build knowledge and skills of vulnerable, women, girls, youth with and without disabilities on flower vases designing and production through trainings to enable them become self-reliant economically.

posts.title: Key Relevant Objectives to economic empowerment programme
objectives: To improve quality of life of socially excluded groups of PWDs, women, youths and their families through economic empowerment programmes.
To build capacity of socially excluded groups of women, PWDs, youths to be able to advocate for inclusive programmes in communities.

column1.title: CAPDIMW.org
column1.text: Promoting inclusiveness among socially excluded groups for a better future.

column2.address: Bangwe Township, Mvula road, old Samaritan Trust campus, Blantyre, Malawi
